ml

Class StanfordMaxentModelImplementation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.StanfordMaxentModelImplementation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArgInsertionMaxentModel, ChildInsertionMaxentModel, DenomMaxentModel, FirstStageMaxentModel, NumberMaxentModel, OtherInsertionMaxentModel, ParentChildReorderMaxentModel, PosMaxentModel, SiblingReorderMaxentModel, TenseMaxentModel, VoiceMaxentModel

    public abstract class StanfordMaxentModelImplementation
extends Object
    An implementation of a maximum entropy model based on the LinearClassifier class from Stanford NLP.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      edu.stanford.nlp.classify.LinearClassifier<String,String> classifier
      The actual maximum entropy classifier used by this implementation
      protected FeatureManager featureManager
      The feature manager used by this model, see FeatureManager
      AutoLoadParams params
      The autoload params used by this model, see AutoLoadParams
      boolean usesRVF
      A flag indicating whether this maximum entropy model uses real valued features (RVFs)

      StanfordMaxentModelImplementation()

      Applies a modification to a vertex of an AMR graph given a single prediction made by this maximum entropy model.

      Automatically loads this maximum entropy model using the parameters specified by an instance of AutoLoadParams
      List<Prediction> getNBestSorted(edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Datum<String,String> datum)
      Returns the n-best predictions (where n is determined by AutoLoadParams.takeBestN) given a feature vector.

      Returns the n-best predictions such that the score of no prediction is below the maximum score minus maxProbDifference, given a feature vector.
      boolean isPositive(String output)
      This may be used to differentiate between "positive" and "negative" results to allow the LossEvaluator to count true/false positives and negatives and compute various metrics based on this information.
      LossEvaluator test(List<Amr> amrs, boolean modifyAmrs)
      This function tests the maximum entropy model using a list of test AMR graphs, constructs a LossEvaluator containing information about the quality of the model and optionally modifies the test graphs using the output of the model via applyModification(Amr, Vertex, List).

    • Method Detail

      • toDatumList

        public abstract List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Datum<String,String>> toDatumList(Amr amr,
                                                                             Vertex vertex,
                                                                             boolean forTesting)
        Extracts from a vertex of an AMR graph a list of feature vectors with outcomes, represented by the Datum class.
        Parameters:
        amr - the AMR graph
        vertex - the vertex
        forTesting - if the feature vector and the outcome should be the gold feature vector and the gold outcome, set this to false. Otherwise, if the feature vector should be computed for testing, set this to true.
        Returns:
        the list of datum objects

      • isPositive

        public boolean isPositive(String output)
        This may be used to differentiate between "positive" and "negative" results to allow the LossEvaluator to count true/false positives and negatives and compute various metrics based on this information.
        Parameters:
        output - the output to check
        Returns:
        true iff the output represents a "positive" event

      • autoLoad

        public void autoLoad(AutoLoadParams params,
                     String filename,
                     boolean train)
              throws IOException
        Automatically loads this maximum entropy model using the parameters specified by an instance of AutoLoadParams
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters to use for loading the model
        filename - the file name under which the model can be found
        train - whether the model should be (re)trained or left as is
        Throws:
        IOException

      • autoLoad

        public void autoLoad(AutoLoadParams params,
                     String filename,
                     boolean train,
                     Function<List<Amr>,LossEvaluator> testFunction,
                     List<Amr> testAmrs,
                     double sigma)
              throws IOException
        Automatically loads this maximum entropy model using the parameters specified by an instance of AutoLoadParams
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters to use for loading the model
        filename - the file name under which the model can be found
        train - whether the model should be (re)trained or left as is
        testFunction - the function used for testing which should map a list of AMR graphs to an instance of LossEvaluator
        testAmrs - the AMRs to be used for testing
        sigma - the value of sigma to be used by the classifier, see LinearClassifier
        Throws:
        IOException

      • trainWithData

        public void trainWithData(List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Datum<String,String>> trainingData,
                          List<edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Datum<String,String>> devData,
                          AutoLoadParams params,
                          String filename)
                   throws IOException
        Trains this maximum entropy model given a list of training and development data.
        Parameters:
        trainingData - the training data to be used
        devData - the development data to be used
        params - the parameters for training, see AutoLoadParams
        filename - the name of the file in which the trained model should be stored
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getNBestSorted

        public List<Prediction> getNBestSorted(edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Datum<String,String> datum)
        Returns the n-best predictions (where n is determined by AutoLoadParams.takeBestN) given a feature vector.
        Parameters:
        datum - the feature vector, represented by an instance of Datum
        Returns:
        the list of predictions

      • getNBestSorted

        public List<Prediction> getNBestSorted(edu.stanford.nlp.ling.Datum<String,String> datum,
                                       int n,
                                       double maxProbDifference)
        Returns the n-best predictions such that the score of no prediction is below the maximum score minus maxProbDifference, given a feature vector.
        Parameters:
        datum - the feature vector, represented by an instance of Datum
        n - the maximum number of predictions
        maxProbDifference - the threshold, the score of no returned prediction is below the maximum score minus this threshold.
        Returns:
        the list of predictions

      • test

        public LossEvaluator test(List<Amr> amrs,
                          boolean modifyAmrs)
        This function tests the maximum entropy model using a list of test AMR graphs, constructs a LossEvaluator containing information about the quality of the model and optionally modifies the test graphs using the output of the model via applyModification(Amr, Vertex, List).
        Parameters:
        amrs - the AMR graphs on which the maximum entropy model should be tested
        modifyAmrs - whether the AMRs should be modified by this method
        Returns:
        the loss evaluator

      • applyModification

        public void applyModification(Amr amr,
                              Vertex vertex,
                              List<Prediction> prediction)
        Applies a modification to a vertex of an AMR graph given a list of predictions made by this maximum entropy model.
        Parameters:
        amr - the AMR graph
        vertex - the vertex
        prediction - the list of predictions

      • applyModification

        public void applyModification(Amr amr,
                              Vertex vertex,
                              String prediction)
        Applies a modification to a vertex of an AMR graph given a single prediction made by this maximum entropy model.
        Parameters:
        amr - the AMR graph
        vertex - the vertex
        prediction - the prediction
